below.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: in a lower place or position, or on a lower level
below.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: an animal that lives below ground
Water was dripping onto the floor below.
I could hear voices in the courtyard below my window.
They camped a few hundred feet below the summit.
Down below,  people were talking and laughing.
Somewhere far below,  a door slammed.
The kitchen is directly below her bedroom.
Captain Parker went below (=to the lower level of the ship), leaving Clooney in charge.
below.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: of a lower rank or having a less important job than someone else
below.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: No one below the level of senior manager was present at the meeting.
officers of the rank of captain and below
below.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: less than a particular number, amount, level etc
below.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Test scores below 50 were classed as ‘unsatisfactory’.
In June the rate of inflation fell below 3%.
Tom’s spelling is well below average  (=much worse than the normal standard).
In winter, temperatures dip to 40 degrees below freezing.
free travel for children four years old and below
below.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: lower on the same page, or on a later page
below.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Details of courses are listed below.
